title: Ben Affleck falls victim to an impersonator who 'set up a profile on dating app Raya'
text:
Ben Affleck has fallen victim to an impersonator who has set up a fake profile on exclusive dating app, Raya, in a bid to find love.

This comes after the American actor, 47 - who split with ex-wife Jennifer Garner in 2015 - was said to be hunting for a normal woman with a career out of the entertainment business on the app.

A source had told Page Six: 'He seems to want a real partner and is not looking to date a celebrity. He is private and is in a good space right now.'

Oh no! Ben Affleck has fallen victim to an impersonator who has set up a fake profile on exclusive dating app, Raya, in a bid to find love

It was continued by the source: 'He has his kids and is focusing on work, but is ready to be in love again.'

However, it has now been claimed that the Batman actor, who has enjoyed a number of short-lived flings since his divorce from Alias star Jennifer, is no longer on dating app, Raya.

MailOnline has contacted representatives for Ben for further comment.

Ben was previously married to Jennifer for 13 years, with the couple splitting in 2015 and their divorce finalised in 2018.

'Real partner': The American actor - who split with ex-wife Jennifer Garner in 2015 - was said to be hunting for a normal woman with a career out of the entertainment business on the app

'Ready for love': It was claimed that Ben is reportedly in a good head space and keen on moving on from his failed romances and settle down with a woman out of the spotlight

The former lovebirds share three children together - Samuel, 7, and Seraphina, 10, and 13-year-old daughter, Violet.

Although they're no longer together, they remain amicable and are often seen with their children and attending church as a family.

Earlier this month, Ben enjoyed a dinner with Laurene Powell Jobs, the widow of Apple founder Steve Jobs.

However, a source at the time told Page Six: 'They have been friends for a long time.'

In 2017, Ben was in a relationship with SNL producer Lindsay Shookus, splitting the first time in August 2018.

He then went on to enjoy a high-profile romance with Playboy model Shauna Sexton which lasted only two months.

During their time together, Ben was admitted to rehab where he was treated for alcohol addiction.

A source from People played down the relationship, claiming: 'There was nothing to split from as it has been casual.'

After Sexton, Ben and Lindsay rekindled their romance, before splitting for good in April 2019.

Before his marriage to Jennifer, Ben was in a romance with his Gigli co-star Jennifer Lopez from 2002 to 2004.

Before that he romanced Gwyneth Paltrow for three years from 1997.
